snippet: The strategy allows the group to build local support while providing some cover against the threat of foreign military action.
abstract: Al Qaeda, in new tactic to maintain power, is increasingly making common cause with local insurgent groups on battlefield in Yemen and Syria; strategy has distinct benefits, but American officials say group continues to be committed to attacking West.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The strategy allows the group to build local support while providing some cover against the threat of foreign military action.

headline.main: Al Qaeda Tries a New Tactic to Keep Power: Sharing It
headline.print_headline: Al Qaeda Tries a New Tactic to Maintain Power: Sharing It

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
